author: barnabasbusa
content:
Another issue we found is `lighthouse-nethermind-1-arm` 
Nethermind reports
```
04 Dec 08:58:02 | Unable to find beacon header at height 28345. This is unexpected, forcing a new beacon sync.
```

LH side, I see a lot of banned/rejected peer connections (non the less there are 50 peers):

```Dec 04 08:59:02.493 DEBG Failed incoming connection              error: Transport error: other: Handshake failed, from: /ip4/34.66.141.224/tcp/56972, our_addr: /ip4/172.18.0.5/tcp/9000, service: libp2p
Dec 04 08:59:02.496 DEBG Failed incoming connection              error: Connection was denied with cause: ConnectionDenied { inner: "Connection to peer rejected: peer has a bad score" }, from: /ip4/34.66.141.224/udp/9001/quic-v1, our_addr: /ip4/0.0.0.0/udp/9001/quic-v1, service: libp2p
Dec 04 08:59:03.015 DEBG Failed incoming connection              error: Transport error: other: Handshake failed, from: /ip4/119.59.123.103/tcp/35204, our_addr: /ip4/172.18.0.5/tcp/9000, service: libp2p
Dec 04 08:59:03.017 DEBG Failed incoming connection              error: Connection was denied with cause: ConnectionDenied { inner: "Connection to peer rejected: peer has a bad score" }, from: /ip4/119.59.123.103/udp/28592/quic-v1, our_addr: /ip4/0.0.0.0/udp/9001/quic-v1, service: libp2p
```

author: parithosh
content:
Annnd we have slashings on devnet-12 (planned) ðŸ˜„

Blobber is running on this machine and explicitly creating equivocating blobs: https://github.com/marioevz/blobber/pull/32

Seems like no nodes fell off the network, so everything is working as expected

author: parithosh
content:
Open topics for devnet-12 are now:
- Lh-nethermind ARM node being stuck
- teku-reth node issue

Once we have some data collected, we'll move on to enabling mev on all nodes

author: barnabasbusa
content: Might be an ethstats bug, but erigon doesn't seem to report any txs in their txpool for ethstats: https://ethstats.dencun-devnet-12.ethpandaops.io

author: rjected
content: could we get reth pairs on ethstats?

author: realbigsean
content:
What are teams planning wrt the blocks V3 endpoint and blocks V2 endpoint deprecation? 

In Lighthouse we're planning to support both endpoints through the Deneb fork and deprecate V2 in a release post-Deneb activation. Is this what other teams are planning? Wondering about when we can/should update our VC's default endpoint to query V3. Our current plan is in the first release post-Deneb activation

author: tersec
content: Nimbus never really supported the blocks V2 endpoint. By the time we would have begun implementing it, it was clear V3 was happening.
